newsitem.title: USA: PS New Mexico San Juan unit restarting.
newsitem.headline: PS New Mexico San Juan unit restarting.

text.p: The 350 megawatt (MW) unit 2 at the San Juan coal-fired power plant in New Mexico is preparing to restart and should begin fuel intake tonight, sources familiar with the plant's operations said Thursday.
The unit was shut Friday night for tube leak repairs, but also had problems this week with a condenser.
San Juan's other 361 MW and two 540 MW units are said to operating at normal rates.
The power plant is operated by Public Service Co of New Mexico.
